conditions.confirmRemoveRole: Are you sure you want to remove the role
conditions.description: Configure the economic and labor rules of the shoot.
conditions.confirmDeleteRoleMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the role {{roleName}}?
conditions.calculationParametersDescription: Adjust here the parameters that feed the texts and calculations of this section.
conditions.calculationParametersDescriptionWeekly: PLEASE REVIEW these parameters before moving forward! These calculations apply across the app.
conditions.introduceWeeklyPrice: Enter the weekly price and the rest of amounts will be calculated automatically. You will only need to manually indicate the reinforcement price.
conditions.introduceMonthlyPrice: Enter the monthly price and the rest of amounts will be calculated automatically. You will only need to manually indicate the reinforcement price.
conditions.introducePricesForSection: Enter prices for this section. If not specified, base team prices will be used.
conditions.noRolesInSection: No roles in this section. Use the "+ Add role" button to add roles.
conditions.amountsCalculatedFrom: Amounts are calculated from Work day price.
conditions.pricesBaseDescription: Base prices are preset. Extra day/Holiday price and Travel day are automatically calculated from the work day price. The rest are manual.
conditions.defaultLegendWeekly: Monthly rate: This price equals the weekly price multiplied by {{SEMANAS_MES}} weeks. Weekly rate: This price equals full weeks of {{DIAS_DIARIO}} days ({{DIAS_JORNADA}} work days of {{JORNADA_TRABAJO}}h + {{JORNADA_COMIDA}}h for lunch/dinner). Daily price: This price is the result of dividing the weekly price by {{DIAS_DIARIO}} days. Work day price: Price equivalent to incomplete weeks (less than {{DIAS_DIARIO}} days) of work. Equals dividing the weekly price by {{DIAS_JORNADA}}. Reinforcement price: Price for workers who work sporadic days. Extra day / Holiday price: This is the price equivalent to the work day price multiplied by {{FACTOR_FESTIVO}}. Travel Day price: This is the price equivalent to the work day price divided by {{DIV_TRAVEL}}. Extra hours: Result of dividing the weekly price by the weekly worked hours ({{HORAS_SEMANA}}) and bonus at {{FACTOR_HORA_EXTRA}}x. It will be considered extra hour from {{CORTESIA_MIN}} minutes after the end of the agreed work day. From the second extra hour there will be no courtesy of {{CORTESIA_MIN}}‚Ä≤. Extra hours are voluntary and must be communicated before the end of the agreed work day.
conditions.defaultLegendMonthly: Monthly rate: This price equals the weekly price multiplied by {{SEMANAS_MES}} weeks. Weekly rate: This price equals full weeks of {{DIAS_DIARIO}} days ({{DIAS_JORNADA}} work days of {{JORNADA_TRABAJO}}h + {{JORNADA_COMIDA}}h for lunch/dinner). Daily price: This is the result of dividing the monthly price by 30 days. Work day price: Price equivalent to incomplete weeks (less than {{DIAS_DIARIO}} days) of work. It is calculated by dividing the monthly price by the result of {{DIAS_JORNADA}} √ó {{SEMANAS_MES}}. Reinforcement price: Price for workers who work sporadic days. Extra day/holiday price: This is the price equivalent to the work day price multiplied by {{FACTOR_FESTIVO}}. Travel day: This is the price equivalent to the work day price divided by {{DIV_TRAVEL}}. Extra hours: Result of dividing the monthly price by ({{HORAS_SEMANA}} √ó {{SEMANAS_MES}}) and applying a {{FACTOR_HORA_EXTRA}}√ó factor. Extra hour is considered from {{CORTESIA_MIN}} minutes after the end of the agreed work day. From the second extra hour there will be no courtesy of {{CORTESIA_MIN}}‚Ä≤. Extra hours are voluntary and must be communicated before the end of the agreed work day.
conditions.defaultLegendAdvertising: Work day price: Base amount per work day. Extra day/holiday price: Equals the work day price multiplied by {{FACTOR_FESTIVO}}. Holiday extra hours equals the work day price multiplied by {{FACTOR_HORA_EXTRA_FESTIVA}}. Technical location: Amount per work day in technical locations prior to filming. If the technical location is more than 5h + 1h, it will count as a full work day. Loading/unloading: Amount per work day for loading and unloading material. This equals 3 extra hours. Travel day: Equals the work day price. Extra hours: Extra hour is considered from {{CORTESIA_MIN}} minutes after the end of the agreed work day. From the second extra hour there will be no courtesy of {{CORTESIA_MIN}}‚Ä≤. Extra hours are voluntary and must be communicated before the end of the agreed work day.
conditions.defaultSchedules: Turn around: Rest between work days will be {{TA_DIARIO}}h between working days and {{TA_FINDE}}h on weekends. All hours that are not rested will be considered extra hours. Night shift: Night work day will be considered when the start or end of the work day is between {{NOCTURNO_INI}} and {{NOCTURNO_FIN}}. It will be bonus with a salary supplement equivalent to one extra hour to each team member.
conditions.defaultSchedulesAdvertising: Turn around: Rest between work days will be {{TA_DIARIO}}h between working days and {{TA_FINDE}}h on weekends. All hours that are not rested will be considered extra hours. Night shift: Night work day will be considered when the start or end of the work day is between {{NOCTURNO_INI}} and {{NOCTURNO_FIN}}. It will be bonus with a salary supplement equivalent to {{NOCTURNIDAD_COMPLEMENTO}}‚Ç¨. In addition, night hours will also be bonus with a {{FACTOR_HORA_EXTRA_FESTIVA}} factor to extra hours.
conditions.defaultPerDiems: The following amounts will be entered on the payroll (tax-free amount) when meals are not available on set as well as when working outside the usual activity center. It will be increased by 50% outside the national territory. An advance will also be made. Lunch: {{DIETA_COMIDA}}‚Ç¨ Dinner: {{DIETA_CENA}}‚Ç¨ Full per diem without overnight: {{DIETA_SIN_PERNOCTA}} ‚Ç¨ Full per diem and breakfast: {{DIETA_ALOJ_DES}}‚Ç¨ Pocket expenses: {{GASTOS_BOLSILLO}}‚Ç¨
conditions.defaultPerDiemsAdvertising: The following amounts will be entered on the payroll (tax-free amount) when meals are not available on set as well as when working outside the usual activity center. It will be increased by 50% outside the national territory. An advance will also be made. Breakfast: {{DIETA_DESAYUNO}}‚Ç¨ Lunch: {{DIETA_COMIDA}}‚Ç¨ Dinner: {{DIETA_CENA}}‚Ç¨ Full per diem without overnight: {{DIETA_SIN_PERNOCTA}} ‚Ç¨ Full per diem and breakfast: {{DIETA_ALOJ_DES}}‚Ç¨ Pocket expenses: {{GASTOS_BOLSILLO}}‚Ç¨
conditions.defaultTransportation:
When due to filming needs, the worker moves outside the usual work center, the amount of {{KM_EURO}}‚Ç¨/km plus tolls and relevant parking expenses will be paid.
In case of transporting team members, it will also be bonus with the amount of {{TRANSPORTE_DIA}}‚Ç¨/extra day.
conditions.defaultAccommodation: In case of having to stay overnight outside the worker's usual residence, the production company must provide a hotel (minimum 3 stars) with individual room and relevant per diems and pocket expenses.
conditions.defaultPreProduction:
The project's gaffer will be entitled to a minimum of 1 work day per week of filming.
The project's best boy will be entitled to a minimum of 1 work day for every two weeks of filming.
In this way, the gaffer and best boy will be registered during the project's pre-production to work on tasks prior to the start of filming (technical locations, material lists, calendars, etc).
conditions.defaultAgreement: The agreement "Resolution of March 22, 2024, of the General Directorate of Labor, which registers and publishes the III State Collective Agreement of the audiovisual production industry (technicians)" will also be taken into account.
conditions.defaultHolidays: Work day and hours on holidays will have a 75% increase. (Holidays {{year}}: {{festivos}})
conditions.translationError: Error translating text. Check your DeepL API key in the console.
conditions.translationApiKeyMissing:
To enable translation, create a .env file in the project root with: VITE_DEEPL_API_KEY=your_api_key

Get your free API key at: https://www.deepl.com/pro-api

payroll.title: Payroll
payroll.description: See what each crew member will be paid based on workdays and reports.
payroll.legendBaseDetail: (Total concepts salary + vacations + flexibility bonus + indemnity, etc)
payroll.butNoPeopleAssigned: but they don't have people assigned to the days. Assign the team to the days of the weeks to calculate the payroll.
payroll.addWeeksInPlanningAndTeam: Start by adding shooting weeks in
payroll.toAppearHerePayroll: for the payroll to appear here.

planning.proEmptyBody: Add a week to start organizing the production calendar.
planning.preEmptySubtext: You can add as many weeks as you need. Later you can duplicate them or export them to PDF.
planning.proEmptySubtext: You can add as many weeks as you need. Later you can duplicate them or export them to PDF.

tutorial.settingsBody: You can replay the tutorial anytime.

tutorial.exitConfirmTitle: Are you sure you want to exit the tutorial?

theme.title: Theme
theme.body: Change the app theme to your preference

newProject.title: New project
newProject.body: Create a new project from here

newProjectForm.title: Project editor
newProjectForm.body: Enter and edit the project's general details

team.title: Team
team.body:
Manage the project team and generate its PDF.
This information is used in planning and reports.

teamAdd.title: Add member
teamAdd.body: Add a new member to the team

teamRow.title: Role and name
teamRow.body: Assign a role and a name to the member

conditions.title: Conditions
conditions.body:
Define the financial conditions and generate its PDF.
These conditions are reflected in payroll.

conditionsParams.title: Calculation parameters
conditionsParams.body:
Review and adjust the project's general parameters. These values apply to reports and payroll.
If you're not sure, you can use the standard values and adjust them later.

planning.title: Calendar
planning.body:
Organize the calendar by weeks and generate its PDF.
Each week is used later in reports and payroll.

planningAdd.title: Add week
planningAdd.body: Tap "Week" to create a new one

planningWeek.title: Week created
planningWeek.body: Here you can review and edit the created week

reports.title: Reports
reports.body:
Review project information and generate reports in PDF.
Reports feed the payroll calculation.

reportsWeek.title: Week in reports
reportsWeek.body: Review the information for the selected week

reportsRange.title: From / to dates
reportsRange.body: This range is used in Payroll to calculate overtime, per diems, mileage, and transport

payrollRange.title: From / to dates
payrollRange.body: This range is the same as Reports. Within these dates, overtime, per diems, transport, and mileage are calculated

payroll.title: Payroll
payroll.body: Review the project payroll and generate its PDF

status.title: Active / Closed
status.body: Close the project when finished to leave it read-only

help.title: Help
help.body: Have questions or suggestions? Write to us from here
